ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Need some opinions
ygData.msgSnippet: No matter when you start, what your level is, or what you re wearing/using, you will ALWAYS find someone to group with.  Even if you don t find someone new to
ygData.messageBody:
No matter when you start, what your level is, or what you're wearing/using, you will ALWAYS find someone to group with.  Even if you don't find someone new to the game, you will find seasoned players that are starting new characters for one reason or another.  These people generally have main characters that are uber high and capable of getting armor/weapons that low levels can't, and if you befriend these epople they might be persuaded to help you out.  and besides, it's easy to go from level 1 to level 30 in mere days.  You won't be low level long.  So come back to Everquest.  We missed you!
 
Wulfric
 
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Yagermeister <odd_yager@...>
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, January 10, 2003 5:40 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] Need some opinions

Hey everyone,

I need some help on my next MPORPG purchase. I played EQ since Beta
and quit about 2 and half years ago (college took priority heh) and
now that I have secured a somewhat stable career, I'm planning to hit
online RPGing again. Question is, being that EQ has been out for 5
years, is it too late to come back and start anew? Meaning am I going
to look ridiculous (prolly will regardless) being the only lvl 6 guy
on the server in cloth and using fine steel? Or should I look for
another MRORPG game? How is Camelot? Or Neverwinter Nights?

Regards,

Yager


Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
